intro: Hieracium salvatorum, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are basal, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium salvatorum is often found in open habitats where it can receive ample sunlight.
